chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:45 AM Defendant VINCENT M. REYNA in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Defendant VINCENT M. REYNA in custody.  Eric Sparr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony taken.  The State moves to dismiss count #2.  Motion Granted.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed for count #1.  Defendant bound over for trial on count #1.  Attorney Goldin requests bond amended to a signature bond.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law to address bond.  The State doesn't object to a reduced cash bond.  The Court will amend bond to $2,000 cash with same conditions.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 9:59.  Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
